fields.summary: Double clicking on branch raises git lock

fields.description:
h3. Versions
* Bitbucket Server 4.9.0
* SourceTree 1.9.6.1
* Windows 8.1
* Oracle JDK 1.8.101
* Git 2.10
* Internet Explorer 11
* Google Chrome

h3. Behavior in Internet Explorer:
# Navigate to the repository in Bitbucket Server
# Click the Clone action
# Click "Clone in SourceTree"
# The following confirmation message shows up:
!1.IE.ConfirmationMessage.png|thumbnail!
# After clicking "Allow", the message "No apps are installed to open this type of link (sourcetree)" is shown:
!2.IE.Message.With.SourceTree.png|thumbnail!

h3. Behavior in Google Chrome:
# Navigate to the repository in Bitbucket Server
# Click the Clone action
# Click "Clone in SourceTree"
# Chrome does absolutely nothing:
!3.Chrome.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround:
There are other ways to clone a repository into SourceTree mentioned [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/sourcetreekb/clone-a-repository-into-sourcetree-780870050.html]
fields.summary: "Clone in SourceTree" button not opening SourceTree
No label fatch

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce
1. Push any changes to repository and provide appropriate push comment
2. Once push is successfully done
3. Push some fresh changes using the push comment used in 1

Once cylic dependency is observed there is no option other than to create new local repository
fields.summary: Cylic dependency observed when last pushed comment is used to do fresh push
Request for Source Tree Installation

fields.description: In certain environments, SourceTree will spawn git processes ons startup that stall, and consume large amounts of system memory.  This will eventually lead to crashes of the OS itself.
fields.summary: Create startup task to eliminate instances of the git process checking remotes and crashing/stalling.

fields.description:
If you rebase a repo, and then add tags to some of the commits - the graph incorrectly shows two or more disconnected paths and the order of the commits gets completely thrown off.
1. Rebase included more than one commit
2. A tag is added to any of the rebased commits other than the last one (the time is the same on all)
3. You are not displaying current branch, rather all branches (even though you may only have one branch)
fields.summary: Branch graph shows incorrect information after a rebase.

fields.description:
When viewing a repo, the size of the side panel (with brances, remotes, subrepos) is not saved. Thus, I keep needing to resize it every time I open a repo.

Also, when browsing through subrepos nested in directories in the side panel, the open/closed state of the directories is not saved. Thus, I need to drill down into the directory tree every time I open the repo to access the subrepo.

I believe version 7 saved these states.
fields.summary: Panel Sizes, Subdirectory Tree Status Not Saved

fields.description:
Not staging, but actual committing to a repo. 

If you select a number of pending changes, and hit the commit button, a new screen appears with the file list (again) and space to type in the commit message. In that screen, sometimes you have to re-select the files, and sometimes it remembers your previous selections. 

It happens randomly, and is not easily reproducible.
fields.summary: File selection after clicking commit is inconsistent.

fields.description:
This one time, I hit Ctrl+Shift+C to start a commit. I got a screen that looked like a splitscreen - on the right is the diff view we're used to, but on the left a SINGLE listview with CHECKBOXES for each file.

What gives? Why did I get that? I thought checkboxes were removed? But there was no staged and unstaged area. Just a SINGLE listview. 

Then I got confused so I wanted to see what happens when I re-enter commit mode. So I click Log/History to back out of commit mode and... FREEZE.

Not much to say about it. The app froze completely. Not responding. And after a while: "SourceTree stopped working" (the familiar message from Windows).
fields.summary: Checkbox view -> Freeze

fields.description: Add the file context menu item "External Diff with Previous" for commited changes like the *Uncommited changes* line
fields.summary: Add "External Diff" menu item to the context menu of commited changes

fields.description:
Switch to File Status tab for a repo. Change to Flat list (multiple columns). It does not matter if "Split view staging" or "No staging" is selected.

Select a filter that will show files listed in the root directory as well as files in some child directories. For the files in the root directory, the Path column will be empty.

However, use the scroll bar to scroll the view down and the files in the root directory scroll up out of view. Next, scroll the view back up to show the files in the root directory. The Path column now shows some other directory in the repository.

 

see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-5063
fields.summary: Flat list (Multiple Column) View in File Status shows incorrect path in Path column

fields.description:
Stop Tracking dialogBox in SourceTree client v1.9.6.1 do nothing when "OK" is pressed. But "Cancel" or the cross pressing runs the process.

!stoptracking.PNG!
fields.summary: Stop Tracking dialogBox in v1.9.6.1

fields.description:
h3. Summary
{{git flow init}} doesn't allow same branch name on _Production Branch_ and _Development Branch_ but SourceTree allow users to initialize Git Flow using the same branch name on both of the fields.
 !GitFlow.PNG|thumbnail! 

Once created with the same branch name, users will receive error - {{fatal: Not a gitflow-enabled repo yet. Please run "git flow init" first.}} when trying to create a new feature/release/hotfix branch although users already initialize git flow.
 !GitFlowError.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click *Git Flow*
# Rename _develop_ to _master_
# Click *OK*
# Click *Git Flow*
# Click *Start New Feature/Release/Hotfix* and insert release name
# Click *OK*

h3. Expected Results
* Able to initialize Git Flow with same Branch name on _Production Branch_ and _Development Branch_
* Received {{fatal: Not a gitflow-enabled repo yet. Please run "git flow init" first.}} when trying to create new feature/release/branch

h3. Actual Results
* Should not able to initialize Git Flow on SourceTree using the same branch name on _Production Branch_ and _Development Branch_
fields.summary: No Error show when having same branch on Git Flow

fields.description:
Hi,

I am trying to clone a repository hosted on a windows server 2012 R2 SMB-share.
Also, I have mapped a new drive "P:\" which is physically "C:\develop\name\".

This give me a error message "unknown error". Whenever I change this folder and add a subfolder to the destination path "e.g. P:\dev" it works fine.

Could you please take a look at this issue asap?
fields.summary: Unable to clone Repository on Root Directory of Windows drive

fields.description:
h6. Problem

When you stage changes, write a message and commit (without pushing) the _'Recent commit messages'_ is not updated. If I close SourceTree and re-open it, then I get latest changes.
h6. How to reproduce
 # Pull from the repository, without any file changes
 # Make several change multiple files/single file(multiple hunks)
 # Commit only one of the changes made, with a message
 # Click on _'Recent commit message' _  icon
 # Message written from the commit in point 3 is not listed
 # Close SourceTree
 # Open SourceTree
 # Click in File Status tab, then _'Recent commit message'_ icon
 # Message written from commit in point 3 is listed as the first element
fields.summary: Recent commit messages not updated

fields.description:
Git will sometimes format its output in a way that assumes a monospace font, making it look ugly in SourceTree for Windows where a proportional font is used. I will attach a screenshot illustrating the issue. Switching to a monospace font in the associated text area should solve this.
----
I cloned this issue because I don't have permission to edit the original issue. Please mark it as duplicate and reopen the original one.
fields.summary: "Show Full Output" area should use monospace font

fields.description:
it appears that open sourceTree for windows software，the top UI bar sometimes show without its description. It occurs occasionally.

the phenomenon just like the picture shows.

picture1
fields.summary: UI bars show without  description

fields.description:
When doing just about anything in the UI, there are long hangs. 
This has been like that since one of the updates, a few weeks ago.
New installation, different PCs, different repositories - all behave the same.
fields.summary: UI hangs for 10-20 seconds when pressing "Commit" or "Push"
Long lines appear blank in diff
Problem with non-Unicode comments in sources

fields.description:
In previous versions of SourceTree once you press CTRL+SHIFT+C to "Commit All" comment box would be focused.

Now this happens only if that fragment is opened or refocused. If you press CTRL+SHIFT+C and then CTRL+ALT+SHIFT++ to add all files to Staged comment box will no longer be focused.

You can't refocus it with CTRL+ALT+C - rather you now need to move mouse.

Also, focus is now lost on CTRL+ALT+SHIFT++ dialog - by default it is on Cancel rather than OK, so instead of single Enter to confirm user needs to SHIFT+TAB and then Enter.
fields.summary: Problems with focus in various dialogs (CTRL+SHIFT+C)

fields.description: I use git hosted on visualstudio.com ad nd would really appreciate being able to create PR's from SourceTree, however it's not an available option. Please add it.
fields.summary: Add Visual Studio Team Services as a Host Type in SourceTree

fields.description:
People like to see what number of columns is taken by the commit message text.
Also monospace fonts are way better for alignment.

Also, SRCTREEWIN-208 should be reopened because it's still there but I don't have permissions to do so.
fields.summary: Use monospace font in commit text box

fields.description:
Selected files below are actually in the git source directory, *not* dosipy\conda !image-2016-09-16-10-54-25-989.png|width=631,height=448!

When I sort by 'path', the issue goes away

!image-2016-09-16-10-54-36-658.png|width=631,height=448!

But when I scroll through the files list and back up, the issue comes back (see first image)!
fields.summary: Incorrect Path Displayed in File List
Add option for (pull&push) button

fields.description: It seems "Stage All" button does nothing. I need to prepare my commit selecting all files and clicking "Stage selected".
fields.summary: "Stage All" button stopped working

fields.description:
It crashed on push. Please check the attached log file.

However after restarting I saw it did do the push correctly.
fields.summary: SourceTree crash -could not read Username

fields.description:
I have a number of repositories set up that link to team repositories in BitBucket. Whenever I try to create a pull request I get a 404 error from the web server. This is due to the path being completely wrong. It appears to assume the repository is a personal one not a team one and the path is completely wrong.

For instance source tree links to the page
 [https://bitbucket.org/Components/Curator/pull-requests/new?source=Components/Curator:acec09dc980b:MD-49_Rationalise_Configuration_Files]

yet if I use the bitbucket web interface to create the pull request I get the address.
 [https://bitbucket.org/ipvltd/curator/pull-requests/new]

My commit/push/pull requests work just fine so it just seems to be the pull request creation.
fields.summary: Create Pull Request resolves to wrong address

fields.description:
Reported via email by Lars Schneider:

Steps to reproduce:

1. Clone https://github.com/larsxschneider/lfstest-individual-files

2. `cd` into the repository and run `cp folder/demo.file folder/big-file1.bin`

3. Add the file in SourceTree to the next commit. On add I get this error message:

 !image001.png|thumbnail! 


Expected behavior:

The file is already tracked by GitLFS but SourceTree does not recognize this:

https://github.com/larsxschneider/lfstest-individual-files/blob/master/.gitattributes#L2
fields.summary: Incorrect warning when adding LFS tracked file in a subfolder

fields.description: The labels in the toolbar disappears sometimes. And reappear at restart. See screenshot.
fields.summary: Labels in menu disappear

fields.description:
I typically work with Mercurial repos with multiple Mercurial subrepos nested within them. With this newer version (updating from 7.x) of SourceTree, I am finding that when I update a subrepo with the main repo open, the pending files list in the main repo is not getting updated. I have to close the main repo and re-open it in order to see the subrepo listed in the pending files list and therefore commit the changes. This is extremely frustrating and is slowing me down a lot.

At the very least, maybe there should be a way to refresh the pending files list to re-scan everything without having to close the repo out, which is very slow (all of the repos I work with are rather large and complex with many subrepos).
fields.summary: Pending Files List Fails to Update

fields.description:
Team Foundation Server 2015 supports pull requests through their web application and API. It would be a great addition to be able to create and complete these pull requests straight from SoucreTree. I believe TFS 2015 Update 2 has better API support as it's required by the Visual Studio Code extension for TFS.

With this in mind it would be awesome to have TFS added as an option when configuring the optional extended integration settings for your repository.
fields.summary: Add extended integration with Team Foundation Server (TFS) 2015 and Visual Studio Online

fields.description: see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-5050

fields.summary: Duplicating Stash names

fields.description: see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-5018
fields.summary: Repeated Auth prompting when using Hg

fields.description:
It looks like there is a problem with the auth prompts for hg 3.9

see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-5018
fields.summary: Problem cloning using Hg 3.9

fields.description: see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-5028
fields.summary: Commit message is not populated after Merge

fields.description:
Currently for hg there is only the ability to discard (revert) hunks when making a commit.  Instead of discarding/reverting them, I'd like to be able to exclude hunks from a commit.  This ability exists in hg, but is not available within SourceTree;  I have been told that this ability exists within SourceTree only when using git. 

 It would be great if this feature was added, since this is the only reason I still have TortoiseHg Workbench still installed on my machine for the occasional times that I need to make a partial file commit.
fields.summary: Ability to Exclude Hunk From Commit - Mercurial

fields.description:
Allow for an option that executes the following command:

git reset --hard && git clean -fd
fields.summary: Provide option to reset repo and clean

fields.description: Allow an option to delete local branches that have been merged into master. Prune and compact afterwards.
fields.summary: Option to delete merged branches

fields.description: Allow for an option to run git gc, whether aggressive or not, on a repo.
fields.summary: Option to run GC on the repo

fields.description:
When resolving merge conflicts SourceTree commit message window does not get populated with the default git commit message i.e. {{.git/MERGE_MSG}}

Previously this default default conflict resolution message would appear in the commit window.
fields.summary: No longer using default git commit message after resolving merge conflicts

fields.description:
It would be awesome to be able to pull repositories without having to open the repository view. Extra points for pulling multiple repositories at once. Maybe by adding a pull option to this context menu:

 !Screen Shot 2016-09-14 at 08.46.19.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow pulling from context menu in repository list

fields.description: see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-4792
fields.summary: Not possible to clone a repo as subtree into a repo

fields.description:
DiffMerge is installed as external diff/merge tool.  Options are set as such in Tools-Options-Diff.  Resolve Conflicts - Launch External Merge Tool brings up the dialog box but does not launch DiffMerge.  

If options are changed to System Default, nothing happens.  Even the dialog box does not appear.
fields.summary: External Diff/Merge does not work
MIssing character escaping in tag message

fields.description: I cannot seem to select a directory in the tree view.  Also when I RMB to perform operations such as add, remove, discard, the menu items are greyed out
fields.summary: Cannot select folders to operate on

fields.description: When I launched SourceTree, a lot of git processes was created and quickly invade my windows task manager (with 100% of CPU). I try to delete my projects from SourceTree, uninstall and reinstall SourceTree (even try to delete temporary files), but I still have the same problem, SourceTree try at startup to launch one of my deleted project (deleted in SourceTree and also on my hard drive). So now I can't use SourceTree anymore...
fields.summary: SourceTree load a deleted project at startup
SourceTree 1.9.6.1 w/ embedded mercurial 3.9.1 - hg flow broken - cannot push changes to server

fields.description:
The tab for each repository does not show the full name and the full name is displayed no where else. I have repository names that all begin the same, so I can't tell what repository I have. This shorting of name happens even when that is plenty of room
Suggestions: 
* Have hovering over tab show the full name.
* Show the full name of the selected repository in the window's title
fields.summary: Can't see name of repository

fields.description:
After being forced to log in to bitbucket with my atlassian account, I can no longer clone repos I have access to using git in a shell on my local machine or by using the sourcetree client. I always get the following error message:

remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.
fatal: Authentication failed for [repo url]

I have searched help on bitbucket and atlassian, and read numerous threads found through a google search on the above error, to no avail. been unable to find any way to resolve this issue.
fields.summary: can't clone repo from bitbucket

fields.description:
when switching branches with double clicking on the node it fails with:
{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false checkout feature/LIB-589_issuename
fatal: Unable to create 'C:/Source/qps-source/.git/index.lock': File exists.

If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
process is running and remove the file manually to continue.
{noformat}

around 50% of the time; however right click -> checkout always works

(sourcetree is the only app accessing the git repo at the time)

our theory is that its because the branches are far apart that updating the right panel takes to much time (as the context menu always appears after that panel has been updated)

its just annoying to us as source tree is our only git app
fields.summary: Switching branches fails

fields.description: See the screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Toolbar has no labels for some buttons

fields.summary: 1.9.6.1 crashes when committing w/o push immed.

When installing I got an Install global ignore dialog box.
The text mentions to click NO to if you want to see all files, but there is no 'NO' button.. 
See attached screen shot.

The latest update of SourceTree 1.9.6.1 does not pass Username and Password to the proxy server.

fields.description: Add try/catch to startup profile.
fields.summary: Add try/catch to startup profile

fields.description:
ERROR [2016-09-07 14:04:35,139] [1] [SourceTree.AppRoot] [HandleCrash] - Fatal error
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at SourceTree.Repo.RepoHelper.CreatePullRequest(Repository repo, RepositoryRemoteProjectLink link, String remoteBranch, String commitSHA) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-prod\Repo\RepoHelper.cs:line 842
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.RepoTabViewModel.CreatePullRequestNoPrompt(String remote, String remoteBranch) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-prod\ViewModel\RepoTabViewModel.cs:line 3301
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.RepoTabViewModel.CreatePullRequestNoPromptIfNotAhead(String localBranch, String remote, String remoteBranch) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-prod\ViewModel\RepoTabViewModel.cs:line 3334
   at MS.Internal.Commands.CommandHelpers.CriticalExecuteCommandSource(ICommandSource commandSource, Boolean userInitiated)
   at System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.InvokeClickAfterRender(Object arg)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes every time I do a Pull Request

fields.description: If I commit or do anything else SourceTree no longer picks up the changes automatically, and instead requires I close the repository tab, or SourceTree completely if you close the tab too many times in order to refresh with changes.
fields.summary: No Longer Refreshes When Git Commands Used in Terminal

fields.description: Have yet to narrow down a specific action that causes it, but at some point, the labels for buttons to the right of 'Pull' disappear. The only way to get them back that I've found is to restart the application.
fields.summary: Toolbar button labels disappearing

fields.description:
Using the "working copy" view in Sourcetree, any file changes on disk will cause the "stage selected" button to be disabled even though the files remain selected in the "unstaged files" list.

Steps to reproduce:

1.  Change files on disk, inside Git repository
2.  Select files in SourceTree "unstaged files" view but do not move to stage
3.  Change files on disk again (any file tracked by Git)
4.  "Stage selected" button will be disabled
fields.summary: Working Copy view: file changes in unstaged files on disk causes "stage selected" button to disable

fields.description:
I use the Envy Code R font as my monospaced font of choice. When I use this font in the Internal Diff View, they way the lines of text are laid out, the letter "q" is indistinguishable form the letter "g". See attached picture.

Dev team see support ticket for screenshot.
fields.summary: Sourcetree clips text in internal DIFF view

fields.description:
All the time when Source Tree updates it stacks previous versions in *Programs and Features -> Uninstall or change a program*.

Then when you try to delete Source Tree you have to delete all this previous versions for remove them from this list.
fields.summary: Source Tree stacks

fields.description:
The terminology between the windows and mac versions of source tree is different for resetting files that have been modified in your local working copy.  Source tree for windows calls it "discard" versus "reset" in the Mac version.  

it would be nice if both versions used the same terminology for the same operation.  I use both versions regularly and I find myself hunting for the command depending on what I'm used to.
fields.summary: Consistent terminology for discard/reset

fields.description:
While in a feature branch I created a stash and named it ITM (and stash deleted my changes)
I then made more changes and did a stash again and by mistake I called it with the same name ITM

Now on the stash list I see two stashes on the same branch with the same name

Problems observed:
1. When clicking on one of them both of the stashes are highlighted (as if you are highlighting by the name)
2. I right clicked the older stash and tried to delete it, the actual result was that the newer one was deleted (as if you scan the stashes from newer to older and delete the first one with the matching name)
fields.summary: Stash with duplicate name

fields.description:
Hi,

I am using SourceTree 1.9.6.1 and when I press Commit or switch to another repository application stacks and it is usable after a minute. After it is usable I try another action and again the same problem. 

It became pain and it seems that it does not serve its purpose in every new version problem grows
fields.summary: Source tree stacks
win bug
dgfdgf
Memory leak - E.g. 3Gb memory after running for couple of days.

fields.description:
Every time I commit all files, and then change a file without closing SourceTree, I lose the ability to see the diff of the changed file both in the panel and with the external diff, forcing me to close and reopen the app.
I have the option to show whitespace enabled, and have an external diff tool configured.
fields.summary: No diff shown for modified files and "External Diff" disabled

fields.description: While viewing the changed files during a merge, they appear in the "Staged files" panel (_I am configured to view the changed files in "Split-View Staging"_).  If they are not yet staged, then click the "Stage All" button.  Chose to view the files in this panel as "TreeView".  Expand the tree's branches.  Then collapse a branch.  When you collapse the branch a git command is executed to unstage those staged files.
fields.summary: Collapsing tree-view branch of "staged" files causes the branch to "unstage".

fields.description:
h3. Summary
SourceTree crash when cloning a GitHub repository

h3. Environment
SourceTree for Windows 1.9.6.1 - Embedded Git 2.8.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Unable to reproduce, this was a one time crash

h3. Notes
Log file: https://support.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/1718375/1718375_sourcetree.log
fields.summary: SourceTree crash when cloning a GitHub repository

fields.description:
When a merge conflict arises, whether by using the action of cherrypicking, rebase or merge, and I try to resolve the conflict for a file clicking in the Resolve Conflicts -> Launch External Merge Tool (TortoiseMerge) the external application is unable to open.

It throws an error: "Can't open file '.\new': The system cannot find the file specified."

The file attempted to be open should be similar to "new stuff.txt". Seems to fail in files with spaces, at least this one have.

 

I'll attach a Windows Problem Steps Recorder file. The last screenshot in the file is me trying to restart the merge, but nothing happens (and in the Resolve Conflicts tab all options remain the same instead of enabling the Launch External Merge tool again).
fields.summary: Unable to Launch TortoiseMerge as an External Merge Tool

fields.description: When using ST and your monitor is 768px or less settings window just too high and ok button is somewhere behind windows taskbar !image-2016-09-02-09-42-18-215.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: cannot resize settings window

fields.description:
"Within the “Clone / Add / Create Repository” window, none of the user interface elements are announced by JAWS. As an example while navigating throughout the “Clone Repository” screen, JAWS remains silent.    

Expected result:  All user interface elements are expected to be announced by JAWS. In this instance JAWS is expected to announce all elements within the “Clone / Add / Create Repository” window. 

Reference:  Section 508, Part 1194.21, Paragraph (d). 

Note: This defect may exist elsewhere within the application."
fields.summary: Certain user interface elements are not announced by JAWS.

fields.description:
"Within the “PuTTY Key Generator” window the legend “Type of key to generate:” is not announced by JAWS when navigating throughout the radio buttons. 

Expected result:  All legends are expected to be announced by JAWS.  In this instance JAWS is expected to announce, “Parameters, Type of key to generate: SSH-2 RSA radio button checked 2 of 3 to change the selection press up or down arrow Alt + R”.  

Reference:  Section 508, Part 1194.21, Paragraph (l). 

Note: This defect was previously identified in TPR ID 7039 for SourceTree v1.6.11.0 - NEAT Pi."
fields.summary: Legend for radio buttons is not announced by JAWS.

fields.description:
"Within the “Network” screen, the position of the “Proxy Server Settings” radio buttons is not announced by JAWS. When the “Use default operating system settings” radio button is accessed JAWS announces, “Proxy Server Settings, Use default operating system settings radio button checked”, instead of announcing the radio button position as, “Proxy Server Settings, Use default operating system settings radio button checked 1 of 2”. 

Expected result:  The position of all radio buttons is expected to be announced by JAWS. In this instance JAWS is expected to announce, “Proxy Server Settings, Use default operating system settings radio button checked 1 of 2”. 

Reference:  Section 508, Part 1194.21, Paragraph (l).

Notes: 
• This defect may exist elsewhere within the application. 
• This defect was previously identified in TPR ID 7038 for SourceTree v1.6.11.0 - NEAT Pi."
fields.summary: Radio button positions are not announced by JAWS.

fields.description:
"User-selected high contrast setting is overridden by the application. While high contrast settings are enabled, within the “Source Tree” main page, the toolbar menu becomes barely visible.  

Expected result:  The application is expected to adopt the user selected operating system color and contrast selections.  In this instance the toolbar menu is expected to remain visible once the user selects high contrast setting.   

Reference: Section 508, Part 1194.21, Paragraph (g).

Notes: 
• This defect may exist elsewhere within the application.
• This defect was previously identified in TPR ID 7037 for SourceTree v1.6.11.0 - NEAT Pi."
fields.summary: Application overrides user selected color and contrast selections.

fields.description:
I switched my Bitbucket credentials over to using my Atlassian ID to take advantage of the SSO. After doing so, I've discovered that SourceTree can no longer authenticate as it does not perceive the email address to be a valid username. 

Naturally, the workaround is pretty easy - I just switched to a different git client. But it'd be handy if the SourceTree accepted the Atlassian ID as valid so I can resume using it for BitBucket repos.

Thanks!
fields.summary: SourceTree Can't Authenticate After Switching to Atlassian ID

fields.description:
Clicking on "Rebase children of xxx interactively..." from the contextual menu on a commit always fails with the following message. Interactive rebase works on the command line git.
Maybe because the .exe extension is missing on stree_gri 

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c "sequence.editor='C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\stree_gri'" -c "core.editor='C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\stree_gri'" rebase -i --autosquash 91fbb1b4d78fd0181fcd928c8d87e498a4b977d2
/usr/libexec/git-core/git-rebase--interactive: line 255: C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\stree_gri: command not found

Could not execute editor

Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Rebase children interactively fail to call stree_gri on windows
Stage file buttons missing

fields.description:
When push, pull, fetch etc. getting

Fatal : ArgumentException encountered error.

but still the push pull operation is performed.
fields.summary: Getting ArgumentException encountered error while push pull, etc.

fields.description:
I'm getting the below error in sourcetree when i do pull, push, fetch, etc..

Fatal : ArgumentExeption encountered 

my source tree version : 1.9.6.1
git version : 2.9.3 using system git.
i'm behind a proxy server
fields.summary: Getting "ArgumentException encountered" error in sourcetree

fields.description: It would be handful if I can only view log of local draft commits. (I usually have lots of local commits, and I don't general care about remote commits.)
fields.summary: Allow showing only draft commits

fields.description: see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-2093?focusedCommentId=674896&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-674896
fields.summary: Investigate the effect of Windows Presentation Foundaction FontCache
SourceTree should ignore file system changes, if they are covered by .gitignore/hgignore

fields.description: When creating a branch on thru Jira, connected to BitBucket; Source Tree's Refresh Repo does not see the new branch. Work around currently is, closing and opening program 2 - 3 times for the branch to display in the remote repository view.
fields.summary: Branches do not update when repo refreshed
Every time I do a commit to GitHub the app crashes

fields.description:
I'm constantly restarting SourceTree to get it to update my branches' status.  Like if I've just commited or if there are updates on master that I want to pull, but sourcetree doesn't see yet.

This has been an issue especially with the last two Source Tree updates.  The OSX version of SourceTree isn't as bad.

"Refresh Remote Status" typically does nothing these days.  I just recently noticed that F5 works better.  I'm starting to use that instead.
fields.summary: Repo state doesn't update until restart of app
Horizontal Scroll Bar missing from code window

fields.description: It would be nice to have GitLab Extended Integration added to SourceTree.  The company I work for has decided to use GitLab to host the repositories.  With the price of free, I couldn't push them toward a paid version of GitHub or BitBucket.
fields.summary: Add Extended Integration for GitLab

fields.description: When switching between two local branches (connected to remotes), the UI often stops to respond. It's not frozen (ie I can for instance open the Menu and things like that) but the Log doesn't get refreshed – it just shows "Loading" on the top – and also the bold font for the active branch is not updated. But the branch switching is done because if I use GIT Bash and change to the respective directory it shows me the new branch as active. This happens about 1 time out of 5 switches. I than have to restart the app.
fields.summary: Switching Branches doesn't update GUI

fields.description:
When I'm switching between some of my tabs, there is an exact 6 seconds delay between click and actual tab activation. During this time, the whole GUI is frozen but SourceTree does NOT consume any resources. There is no heavy CPU or disk usage at all. Restarting SourceTree does NOT help.
This bug is present for a few weeks (maybe even months).
fields.summary: GUI freezes for 6s when switching between some tabs

fields.description:
About 25% of the time when I try to commit, SourceTree hangs.  It seems like it is just processing, but it never finishes even if I leave it a long time.  Killing it from Process Explorer and committing again has always worked;  I just have to type the commit message again.

I don't know if the hang is related to the messages in the SourceTree log file or not, but FWIW...

The SourceTree log file shows only one kind of error, but it shows up a lot (about 100 times already today).  I don't know for sure if it happens around the time that it hangs or not:

{{ERROR [2016-08-29 07:47:42,956] [34] [System.IO.FileSystemWatcher] [OnError] - RepoWatcher: Error 'Too many changes at once in directory:S:\System Control Schematic and PCB.'
ERROR [2016-08-29 07:51:07,081] [34] [System.IO.FileSystemWatcher] [OnError] - RepoWatcher: Error 'Too many changes at once in directory:S:\System Control Software\SystemControlOnJumbo\SystemControl.'}}

I just noticed that the paths in those error messages are not used for the commit I am trying to do;  the working copy is on C: and the Git repo is in S:\System Control Software\SystemControlGitRepo.  I do have SourceTree bookmarks for projects in the two directories that cause the error messages but I am not viewing those projects in SourceTree when it hangs, so it shouldn't need to try to update them.  If I do view those projects in SourceTree, they seem to display fine (it takes a few seconds, but not very long - they don't have many files).  

I don't know if my issue is related to these reports or not:
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/40343927/-sourcetree-not-responding
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/39781647/sourcetree-v1.9.6.0-crashes-when-i-press-commit
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-5366?src=confmacro

I don't think it is related to this one because that crash happens when they try to enter the commit message, while this one happens after entering that message, when clicking the Commit button.
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-5326?src=confmacro

P.S.  I previously posted about this in the Atlassian Answers forum here: <https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/40346900/answers/40346917?flashId=1457113769>
fields.summary: SourceTree sometimes hangs when Commit button is pressed

fields.description:
This error show when i tryh to clone my branch :
error: RPC failed; curl 56 Illegal or missing hexadecimal sequence in chunked-encoding
fields.summary: Not Allow clone my branch

fields.description:
Repository tabs appear in the order they were opened, and changes to the tab order does not persist between application launches.

* Open at least one repository
* Drag tabs to change the order
* Close the application
* Open the application - the tabs will appear in the order the repositories were opened

(Screenshot attached to clarify which tabs)
 !image-2016-08-30-10-44-48-410.png|thumbnail! 

My apologies if this is a duplicate, but all of the other tab-related issues I found seemed different enough to warrant a new issue.
fields.summary: Save repository tab order

fields.description: When many tabs are open; the name of the repos are clipped, it'd be nice to be able to hover over the clipped names and see a tooltip of the full name (as you can in the same situation in Chrome's browser tabs).
fields.summary: Show full repo name in tooltip tab mouse hover

fields.description: Pre 1.9.6.0, SourceTree would only poll for changes when it was the main highlighted window/program.  Now it constantly polls in the background regardless of whether the ST window is active or not.
fields.summary: SourceTree polls for repos changes in the background when minimized.
